title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ATLANTA (AP) — The box score will read that the Atlanta Hawks defeated the Los Angeles Clippers, 103-88. But the story, the one they’ll tell for years, is about one man’s singular, breathtaking dominance.

This was the night Dominique Wilkins authored a masterpiece.

Wilkins, "The Human Highlight Film," poured in a staggering 47 points, turning a routine regular-season contest into his personal showcase. From the opening tip, it was clear something special was brewing in The Omni. He attacked from every conceivable angle, a whirlwind of athletic fury and finesse that the Clippers had no answer for.

His 18 field goals were a testament to a relentless offensive assault, a mix of thunderous drives to the basket and his trademark high-flying jams that brought the crowd to a fever pitch. When the defense sagged, he stepped back, coolly draining four three-pointers. And when fouled, he was nearly automatic, converting 7 of 8 from the line. He was, quite simply, unguardable.

While Wilkins provided the fireworks, the Hawks provided the support. Dikembe Mutombo anchored the defense with 13 points and a formidable 19 rebounds, his presence in the paint allowing Wilkins to freelance. Mookie Blaylow facilitated the offense, dishing out 15 assists, many of which found their way into the hands of the red-hot Wilkins.

The Clippers, led by Loy Vaught’s 20 points and 12 rebounds, simply could not keep pace with the historic offensive eruption unfolding before them. They were not just beaten by a team; they were overwhelmed by a force of nature.

On this night, the final score was a mere footnote. The real headline was a number: 47. A number that cemented another legendary chapter for one of the game's most electrifying scorers. It was a performance for the ages, a reminder that on any given night, greatness can take the floor and put on a show.
